title: River Rafting
short_description: Navigate turbulent river rapids ranging from Grade I to Grade IV.
long_description:
White water river rafting is one of the most popular group adventure sports in India. It involves navigating a river in an inflatable raft, paddling in unison to overcome turbulent currents and rapids. The sport demands teamwork, quick reflexes, and a spirit of adventure.

Rishikesh is undoubtedly the rafting capital of India, where the Holy Ganges offers rapids ranging from easy Grade I to thrilling Grade IV sections like 'The Wall' and 'Three Blind Mice'. But rafting isn't just a Himalayan activity. In the west, the Kundalika River in Kolad (Maharashtra) offers year-round rafting thanks to dam-released waters. For the truly adventurous, the Zanskar River in Ladakh offers multi-day expeditions through frozen gorges.

Rafting trips usually differ by distance (12km, 16km, 24km) and difficulty. Most commercial operators provide a helmet, life jacket, and paddle, along with a certified guide in every raft who steers and shouts commands.

locations.summary: The world-renowned hub for rafting on the Ganges with rapids named 'Roller Coaster' and 'Golf Course'.
Dam-controlled river allowing for consistent rapids just 3 hours from Mumbai/Pune.
The 'Grand Canyon of Asia' – a serious multi-day expedition for adventure lovers.
Rafting where the Teesta meets the Rangeet river, offering scenic but challenging waters.
Short but intense rafting through coffee estates during the monsoon.
Grade II and III rapids on the Kali River, great for beginners.

opening_hours.time_notes: Kolad rafting is time-specific (usually 8:30 AM) due to dam release schedules.

operating_season.off_season: Monsoon (Rishikesh closed July-mid Sept); Kolad is BEST in Monsoon.
operating_season.season_notes: Check local river levels; high water can cancel trips.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Rishikesh prices are highly competitive and negotiable on weekdays.

safety_guidelines: Always wear your Life Jacket (PFD) and ensure it's tight. Do not loosen it.
Wear a helmet at all times.
Listen to body surfing and rescue commands ('Get Down', 'Paddle Forward').
Do not bring valuables or non-waterproof cameras.
Do not panic if you fall in; float on your back with feet downstream.
equipment_checklist: Strap-on sandals or waterproof shoes (no flip-flops)
Change of clothes (you will get 100% wet)
major_experiences: Body surfing (jumping into calm sections of the river)
Cliff jumping (often included in Rishikesh trips)
Maggi and chai stops at river beaches

sample_itinerary.one_day: 9:00 AM: Reach rafting office. 9:30 AM: Transfer to Marine Drive (Start Point). 10:00 AM: Gear up & safety briefing. 10:30 AM: Launch. Navigate rapids like 'Three Blind Mice'. Stop for cliff jumping. 1:00 PM: Finish at Laxman Jhula.

booking_details.suggested_stay: Stay in Tapovan (Rishikesh) or riverside camps for the full experience.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Rishikesh is 5-6 hours drive from Delhi. Nearest airport: Dehradun (Jolly Grant).

highlights: Rishikesh offers the classic rafting experience with holy river vibes.
Kolad is unique for its 14km stretch available all year round.
Includes fun side activities like body surfing and cliff jumping.
Rapids range from Grade I (Easy) to Grade IV (Challenging).
Perfect teamwork activity for groups and corporates.
